creator: robert.leathley@ricardo.com
text:
When starting Apache, the ldap cache sometimes cannot be initialised, error_log:

[Tue Jun 08 12:31:59 2004] [debug] util_ldap.c(1104): (2)No such file or
directory: [24987] ldap cache init: No such file or directory

In this case, deleting the old /tmp/mod_ldap_cache and restarting results in
successful cache initialisation.

I think this is the result of a previous unclean shutdown of Apache.

This seems to be a bug in apr, where the shared memory doesn't clean up after
unclean shutdown.
creator: minfrin@apache.org
bnicholes@apache.org
text:
Is this still an issue with 2.0.52?  Patch util_ldap.c r1.6.2.21 should have 
fixed this problem.
